Material used.Description: The experiment was conducted using HEK293 cells expressing wild-type or mutant LRRK2 protein.

Readout description.Result Description: The G2019S mutation leads to increased kinase activity and enhanced phosphorylation of alpha-synuclein.

Biological replicates.Description: Not explicitly mentioned in the provided context.

Technical replicates.Description: Each experimental condition was tested in triplicate or more to ensure consistency.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 protein or cells were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector or cells without any LRRK2 expression were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Not explicitly mentioned in the provided context.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Normal kinase activity levels (e.g., within a defined range based on wild-type LRRK2 function).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significantly increased kinase activity or altered phosphorylation patterns indicative of pathogenic changes.

Approved assay.Description: Functional assays are commonly used to study the role of genetic variants in Parkinson's disease.
